subject: Dear Dolphins
event:
Dear Miami Dolphins,

Now that Brett Favre has retired, can we please have Chad Pennington back?  

                                                                Mike Tannenbaum
                                                                New York Jets


Hmmmm.  Wonder what Vinnie Testaverde is doing?

comments.article: Favre retired again?  Wonder how long this time will last.
Favre should take the black and guard the Wall

comments.subject: ahaha

comments.upictitle: Proud to be a geek.  Proud to be a gentleman.: data-wtf
comments.article: You are a funny man!
comments.subject: LOL!

comments.article:
He's only retired long enough to get the press to hang on his every word when he starts talking about playing again.

I was one of the few in Wisconsin that is happy he is not on the Packers anymore - in theory we won't have to listen to months of his "I'm retired .. no I'm not .. " crap again this year.
Yeah, I think everyone who's been a Packer fan for a while knew this was coming.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: facepalm
comments.article: Yeah, I totally face-palmed at the news.

Dear GRRM,

Now that you have teased us for a year, can you please update us on A Dance With Dragons?

Anxious Fan,
Justyn V

Hmmm....Wonder what Joe Haldeman is doing?
comments.subject: Dear GRRM

comments.article: As soon as you update us on your TPS reports at work.
comments.subject: Re: Dear GRRM

comments.article: You can have Matt Cassell for Kerry Rhodes and your next ten first round draft picks.
But won't he have Patriot cooties by now? :-P
Too bad the NFL doesnt subscribe to the notion that the English Premier League has on sending players out on loan.

Thank you New York Jets for Pennington, I called it in sept./oct. on this blog that he would go in New York and win the division for the dolphins.  By great luck I was at the game. Good times.   Sorry George, Jets are in a lot of trouble as they have an aging, pricy roster and now they are supposed to rebuild around one those awful QB's on their roster or a rookie.
comments.subject: Sorry Jets

comments.article: I think they should really give Ratliff a chance at QB before they decide to make any major additions.
What's Brook Bollinger up to, these days?  >;-}
Brett Farve is like herpes - he never goes away. Of course, I have to despise that Packer like the good Viking chica I am. :p

Vinnie?

What about Ken O'Brien?

Heck, why not Joe Namath? They must have the Six-Million-Dollar-Man technology perfected. A couple of weeks at AA and he'd be better than anyone else the Jets Mgmt will bring in... :)
Not on your life, sir.
Pennington, no, but they'd probably make the Jets a good deal on a slightly used Parcells.
No, no. Mike's looking towards the other Brett.

Dear Jets,

Hell, er, I mean heck no!

Sincerely,

Dolphins Nation
comments.subject: Umm, heck no

comments.article: Aaron Brooks is warming a couch somewhere....

I was laughing at Jets' fans before the season started, during the season, and even moreso now. The trade for the bipolar-Favre was a bomb waiting to explode. As a previous posted put, I picked the Fins to go from worst to first as well...even made, and won, a bet on it.

About the only light I see at the end of the Jets' tunnel is the possibility they might get Sanchez from USC...but therein lies a problem too--how many recent QB's from USC have done anything at the professional level?

Good luck.
comments.subject: Still laughing...

comments.article: Sanchez is going to be a bust. He should have stayed the extra year at usc.
comments.subject: Re: Still laughing...

comments.article:
Is there not a Mets / Yankee thing with the football teams in New York? I thought you had to choose a team and were not allowed to cheer for both in New York.
I think the Jets would take a do-over now, the Cowboys will let you have Brad Johnson. :)
comments.subject: I'm a confused Cowboys fan...

comments.article: NYC was and is a baseball town. There is a Giant/Jets hometown rivalry between both the fans and the players. It is generally not to the point of fanaticism with the football, basketball or hockey teams as it is with the Mets and Yankees. That fanaticism goes back to the days when the Dodgers, Giants and Yankees all vied for dominance. Nowadays the fanaticism has decreased somewhat as the vast numbers of college educated immigrants from other states has gentrified and diluted the fandoms. ;)
comments.subject: Re: I'm a confused Cowboys fan...
Re: I'm a confused Cowboys fan...

comments.article: Honestly George, please don't pretend that the Jets had any chance of success last season or in the future with Chad at QB.  Yes, Brett fell apart at the end, largely due to the torn tendon that ruined his arm...but Pennington succeeded in large part due to the "Wildcat" formation and a tremendous running game with Ricky Williams and Ronnie Brown - and great coaching and leadership from Sporano and Parcells.  And his motivation to prove the Jets and everyone else wrong last year was HUGE.  Wait and see how things go this coming year before thinking that bringing him back would be anything other than a disaster for the Jets.  They need a new QB, but they also should get dramatically better the next two years with Rex Ryan in charge.
comments.subject: Dear Dolphins
